item.description: Architecture Comparison European Key characteristics Domes, columns, tunnels Stained glass Flying buttresses Background Multiple eras–Byzantine, Romanesque, Gothic, Renaissance Great influence on world architecture Byzantine → Muslim & Moorish architecture Renaissance → Colonial Americas Religious: funerary architecture Christians believe in the afterlife, so tombs were often extravagant East Asian Key characteristics Timber frames: wood > stone Wood is more flexible than stone Yellow-glazed roof tiles Lack of nails for earthquakes Background Chinese origins Religious and cultural influence Chinese cosmology impacted overall planning Door gods Walls face the main entrance Buddhism and Confucianism Temples Low ceilings have travelled to Western architecture !

Ibn Battuta traveller ![[Pasted image 20220831163116.png]] Anatolia (1330 - 1331) ![[Pasted image 20220831205353.png]] Located in modern Turkey Arrived in Alanya (Alaya) in Anatolia Busy trading port Known for its wood which came from Syria to Egypt Conquered by the Muslims but still a lot of Christians Christians treated him well Everyone was really nice Battuta was surprised that it was common to eat hashish, a drug similar to marijuana Next went to Antaliya (Adalia) Christians, Greeks, Jews, and the kings live all separately, walled off Muslims lived in the main city Dancing and whirling were popular in the Turkish and Persian culture Women were respected a lot Women didn’t cover their entire face Still, there were slave girls What a beautiful place with such beautiful people, both inside and out.
